title: Australian Red Cross leaving Humanity Place
text:
The Australian Red Cross has put its Queensland headquarters in Brisbane up for sale as part of a plan to release value from key properties.

The Red Cross has owned and occupied the property, known as Humanity Place, at 49-57 Park Road in Milton on Brisbane's CBD fringe since it bought the 2638sq m building from Fort Lane Properties for $6.8 million in 2004. Price expectations are understood to be in the early teens.

The Australian Red Cross paid $6.8m for the three-level building in 2004.

“Red Cross will reinvest the funds to move to premises in Brisbane’s CBD or CBD fringe that are both more affordable to own or lease, and better suited to the needs of the people we work with,” said Red Cross chief executive Judy Slatyer.

“As community needs change, the need to operate from a particular premises changes. The sale is part of a national property masterplan that releases value from several key properties and allows us to work in locations that best serve the people who use them, from clients and volunteers to staff and partners.”

Colliers International’s Hunter Higgins, Nick Wedge and Guy Wells in conjunction with Christian Sandstrom and Blake Goddard of Knight Frank will steer a national expression of interest campaign closing in late November. Matthew Berg from Partner Developments has been appointed transaction manager.
description: The Red Cross has owned and occupied its Brisbane CBD fringe headquarters since 2004.
